intro: Fumaria officinalis f. wirtgenii, commonly known as the Wirtgen's yellowcrown, is a botanical variant of the common fumitory. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae, characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found in Europe and parts of Asia. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. This form is distinguished by specific morphological traits that set it apart from the typical fumaria species.
